instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H_REG: What is PP3V42_G3H_REG? PP3V42_G3H_REG is another way to say PP3V42_G3H. PP3V42_G3H_REG and PP3V42_G3H are a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: 8203115 board no green
threads.message:
new board 3115, no green light and no ppbus , no <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H_REG</SIGNAL> too

i replaced <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>, <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H_REG</SIGNAL> is good now , still no green light ,and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=12.26v,

is smc bad?

threads.title: 8203115 board no green
threads.message: 12.26 is going to mean the SMC is not running. What do you get on <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: 8203115 board no green
threads.message: and this board has no water or liqued damage

threads.title: 8203115 board no green
threads.message: That sounds like a bad SMC.

threads.title: 8203115 board no green
threads.message: I second bad SMC..... Rarely the ISL can cause the PPBUS being 12.26 issue so it's worth a shot to throw one on. If a new ISL doesn't work, replace the SMC

threads.title: 8203115 board no green
threads.message: Liquid or not, still beep out the data lines 6259 / SMC and probe for comms.... But yeah, you probably could have just slapped another SMC on there and had it working without posting the thread.
